title.native: 遊☆戯☆王ARC-V（アーク・ファイブ）

description: Thanks to the Leo Corporation, headed by Reiji Akaba, new advancements to Solid Vision, the holographic system that gives life to the Duel Monsters card game, give physical mass to monsters and environments, allowing players to interact directly with them. This has given birth to challenging Action Duels, in which duelists may traverse environments to locate Action Cards to help them in a pinch. The story follows Yuya Sakaki, a second year middle school student at Miami City's You Show Duel School, whose father disappeared three years ago when he was scheduled for an important duel. While facing off against the current Action Duel champion, Yuya awakens a new power from his pendant, known as Pendulum Summoning.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
__Genres:__ J-pop, Alternative rock, indie pop, pop rock, hard rock

__Biography:__
Mrs. GREEN APPLE is a three-member Japanese rock band from Tokyo that made its major debut in 2015 with EMI Records. They are known for performing the ending theme to the anime series Yu-Gi-Oh! ARC-V as well as their first full album, Twelve, which placed 10th on the Japanese national Oricon charts. Their song "Inferno" is used as the opening theme for the first season of the anime Fire Force.

__Members:__
**[Motoki Oomori](https://anilist.co/staff/150857)** (大森元貴) — vocals, guitar (2013–present)
Born September 14, 1996 in Tokyo

Hiroto Wakai (若井滉斗) — guitar (2013–present)
Born October 8, 1996 in Tokyo

Ryoka Fujisawa (藤澤涼架) — keyboards (2013–present)
Born May 19, 1993 in Nagano

__Former Members:__
Takumi Matsuo — bass guitar (2013–2014)

Ayaka Yamanaka (山中綾華) — drums (2013–2021)
Born February 5, 1995 in Tokyo

Kiyokazu Takano (髙野清宗) — bass guitar (2014–2021)
Born October 2, 1991 in Nagano

(Source: Wikipedia (Mrs. Green Apple, edited)

[Profile (Animo Produce)](https://animoproduce.co.jp/artists/onokensho/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ono_kensho) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kenshoono1005/)

Married to voice actress [Kana Hanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95185/).

**Non anime roles:**

- Harry Potter - *Harry Potter* franchise (Live action films; JP dub)
- [Diluc Ragnvindr](https://anilist.co/character/187554/) - *Genshin Impact* (Video Game)
- Enforcer - *Arknights* (Mobile Game)
- Miles Morales - *Spider-Man: Into The Spider Verse; Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse* (Films; JP dub)
- Strohl - Metaphor: ReFantazio (Video Game)

__Skills & Abilities:__ shooting a firearm

[Website](http://yoshimasa-hosoya.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hosoya_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshimasa.hosoya/) | [Staff Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshimasa_hosoya_staff/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6cry8C4nNpobQdf8be7cdw) | [YT Twitter](https://twitter.com/bokudake369) | [Weibo](https://weibo.com/u/7599287210)


A Japanese voice actor, singer and narrator. He graduated from Tokyo Announce Gakuin Performing Arts College, then joined Mausu Promotion Actor Training Center in 2002, and signed on with Mausu Promotion in 2006. He is currently a freelancer.

__Awards:__
- 8th Seiyuu Awards - Best Supporting Voice Actor for his role as [Yuusuke Asahina](https://anilist.co/character/47223/)
- 10th Seiyuu Awards - Best Supporting Voice Actor for his roles as [Orga Itsuka](https://anilist.co/character/89235/) and [Ginti](https://anilist.co/character/88683/)

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Welt in "Honkai Star Rail" (VG)
- Gaius Worzel in "The Legend of Heroes" series (VG)
- Basilio Lupus Magnus in "Metaphor: ReFantazio" (VG)

超特急 (Bullet Train) is a Japanese boy group under Stardust Promotion.

[Website](http://bullettrain.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sd_bt)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/katsuono)**

**Katsumi Ono** is a Japanese director, supervisor, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Official Site](https://cinemastaff.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cinemastaff_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/cinema_staff/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/cinemastaffofficial/)

Japanese alternative rock band. Originally formed as "Real" when the band members were still in high school, they made their major debut on the label Pony Canyon in June 2012 with the release of their EP "Into the Green". Their single "Great Escape" was used as the second ending theme to the anime television series [*Attack on Titan*](https://anilist.co/anime/16498).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/simon.lupin/)

An Italian actor, voice actor and dialogue writer, mostly known for his roles as [Izuku Midoriya](https://anilist.co/character/89028/), [Cabba](https://anilist.co/character/127219/), [Citron](https://anilist.co/character/87633/) (Clemont / Lem), [Tenma of Pegasus](https://anilist.co/character/3776/) and [Capeta Taira](https://anilist.co/character/7161/).
